page.title: 16SOUTHFIELD CLUMP
page.content: SOUTHFIELD CLUMP The family living at Watts Barn are very concerned with conservation and are setting up a small local project. Southfield Clump is a small wood containing a wide variety of shrubs and trees. Larger mature trees include mostly ash,a few beech, oak,lime and Scots Pine. In some areas where large elm have been extracted, many small plants and shrubs have appeared.There are many young beech trees growing throughout most of the wood,also two small areas of ash saplings.To the NW is a section of young wild cherries.At the S.andW. edges are hedgerows of hawthorn,elder.dog rose and wild privet. In two glades within the wood, butterflies are very common.
